result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter S Widucki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns. No contact with Katherine Hawkins.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar type meeting per week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter S Widucki

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter S Widucki in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Defendant Peter S Widucki in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CM74, 16CM141, 16CM109 and Agency case 16-18720. Called 2:40 PM. State - here for change of plea and Wilmouth change of counsel. State indicates there is an agreement. Wilmouth agrees and recites agreement- 16CM74 - G to count 2, domestic abuse deleted, recommends court costs. Counts 1, 3, 4 & 5 would be DRI. 16CM109 - Count 1 enter G plea, with hold sentence and place on probation for one year, 30 days in FC jail with huber, AODA assessment and follow through, 25 hours of community service, FT employment, job search, no consumption of alcohol or possession, no entry into any bars/taverns. 16CM141 - Count 1 would plead G - with hold sentence of one year probation with same conditions as 16CM109, no additional jail time. Count 2 would be DRI. Agency case 16-18720 - State has agreed to global resolution will not seek criminal charges on this case. Widucki agrees. Court - 16CM109 - Count 1 - Widucki pleads G. 16CM141 - Court DRI count 2, Widucki pleads G to count 1. 16CM74 - Court DRI counts 1, 3, 4 & 5, deletes DA enhancer on count 2 and Widucki enters G plea to count 2. Court vacates bond in Agency case 16-18720 as State will not be prosecuting. Court has PLQ and goes over it with defendant, finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, court accepts pleas and adjudges guilty. State makes final argument. Wilmouth makes final statement. Widucki makes statement, remorseful. Wilmouth indicates bond was up for forfeiture and ask that it be applied to the case in which it was posted. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences to the following: 16CM109 - Count 1 - Withhold sentence and place on probation for one year with conditions of: AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations, 50 hours of community service, FT employment, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, one AA/NA or similar community treatment program per week, no contact with Katherine Hawkins, imposes 30 days in FC jail with huber, eligible for community service, costs in each case paid through probation. 16CM141 - Count 1 - With hold sentence and place on probation for one year, same conditions with no additional jail time or community service hours. 16CM74 - Count 2 - imposes costs only, 60 DTP/CO. Wilmouth asks for time to report to arrange transportation for huber. State does not object. Court will allow time to report, 10/28/2016 at 4:30, however must sign up for probation today. Bond posted in 16CM141 shall be applied to case and any amount left to be returned to the poster. DNA sample required (expungement verbage given), appeal rights given.

Bail/bond hearing on November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter S Widucki in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:21 PM. 16CM141 - here for voluntary appearance and initial appearance. Wilmouth asking to re-instate bond for stated reasons. On cases 16CM74 & 16CM109 which are set for JT, Atty. Kennedy remains counsel, Widucki is asking for substitution of attorneys. Wilmouth asks for FPT in this case 16CM141 and possible global resolution of all cases. Wilmouth objects to forfiture for stated reasons. Court doesn't believe Widucki was confused about last appearance for stated reasons and will not set aside bond forfiture, however will quash warrant. State makes comment that he believes there is a communication problem between counsels. Wilmouth makes statement. Court will allow this appearance as an objection to the forfieture and have it set for a bail/bond forfiture hearing, if case can be resolved then a PLEAS can be scheduled and forfiture will remain pending until FPT. Court bond is still there pending forfiture, same conditions.  Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on October 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Peter S Widucki not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:06 AM. State - not sure where the defendant or attorney are, thought that SPD may be representing him. Court forfeits bond posted, was given notice last time in Court. State - warrant body or $750.00. Court so issues.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 28, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Peter S Widucki in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:51 PM. Called 16CM141, 16CM74 and 16CM109. State - here for FPT on 16CM74 and 16CM109. Kennedy states that he is not representing the defendant on 16CM141 - did not have retainer fee. Widucki states that is correct. Court reviews defendants income. Court will adjourn 16CM141 to find out if the defendant is eligible for SPD. Set 16CM141 for AIA on 9/28/16 at 1:45 PM, provided with court appointed paperwork in Court and gives ramifications of returning without counsel on that matter, continues bond on that matter at this point. Court proceeds on 16CM74 and 16CM109. Kennedy states that he has attempted to solve all three matters with the DA but have not resolved all three matters yet due to schedules of both Kennedy and DA. Court reminds Kennedy that DA can't deal with him on 16CM141 as he is not representing him on that matter. Kennedy states that he did not talk to the defendant in regards to the plea offers on these two matters. State makes statement, have received documents in regards to 16CM74 but has not had a chance to review it yet. State - offer was to pleads to the drug counts on 16CM74 and to bail jumping on 16CM109 with probation only, no jail time. Court will allow an adjourment for the FPT to allow the state to research what he has been provided by Kennedy. A member of the audience makes statement in regards to the defendant obtaining counsel on the new matter and getting these matters resolved with Mr. Kennedy. Court cannot deal with issues between the defendant and his attorney. Court sets 16CM74 and 16CM109 for another FPT, continues bond on all matters. Widucki asks if he can get a bond reduction on 16CM141 and refund bond to poster. Court denies at this point.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Peter S Widucki in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:24 PM. Widucki does not have complaint. State provides defendant with complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Widucki understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can afford his own, plans on seeking counsel. Court continues bond at this point, can be modified once an attorney is retained. Court sets this matter for AIA on 9/14/16 at 1:15 PM. Defendant instructed to inform Kennedy of this date and time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
